#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

### 2.1. Concatenate Descriptors with GNNs

As shown in Figure 1, the concatenation strategy (17,18);) examined in this work proposes to train a neural network to predict activity by combining a GNN-derived molecular representation with the expert-crafted descriptors. (19);) Specifically, for a representation h from the GNN, it is concatenated with the descriptor hdp.

h=GNN(m)

ˆp=f([h||hdp])

where m is the input molecular graph and hdp is a descriptor. f(·) is a classifier, usually a Multi-Layer-Perceptron (MLP). p̂ is the predicted activity.

The model is trained by optimizing the binary cross entropy loss L

L=−1nn∑i=1yilog(ˆp)+(1−yi)log(1−ˆp) [...] As a solution, integrating the expert knowledge in the GNN workflow has become a new trend. (16);) Expert knowledge can help supplement the data-hungry GNNs with prior knowledge to increase data efficiency and overcome intrinsic GNN shortcomings. One of the simplest ways to integrate expert knowledge is to combine the expert-crafted descriptors with GNN-learned representation through concatenation. (17,18);) However, while commonly used, a thorough evaluation of this concatenation strategy is lacking. Furthermore, contextualizing this approach against existing virtual screening methods─both traditional and ML-based─is essential to understand its practical utility.
